About
About
I have a very eclectic background and am competent in many areas. Among other things, I spent much of my career successfully developing profit and non-profit organizations, re-organizing and turning around troubled organizations, and securing funds for major organizational and capital projects. I am an excellent writer and public speaker.

Most of my work at this stage of my life involves cross-cultural orientation, public speaking on the wisdom of Indigenous Elders for modern times, writing articles on western and Indigenous worldviews, and presenting as a visiting scholar at universities. I am the founder and president of the Global Center for Indigenous Leadership and LIfeways (www.gcilll.world) and co-founder of the Wisdom Weavers of the World (www.wisdomweavers.world) and main spokesperson.

Co-Founder and Key-Speaker

Co-Founder and Key-Speaker
Wisdom Weavers of the World · Contract
Wisdom Weavers of the World · Contract
Nov 2017 - Present · 8 yrs
Nov 2017 to Present · 8 yrs
Aang waan, hello my other self,
In 2017 on Kaua'i, Hawai'i 13 Elders from around the world gathered to answer two questions:
What is the state of the world as they see it now?
& What must we be doing now?
The result was a co-created message from the Elders and a request from the Elders that I head the efforts to carry it to humanity. 
A support-team was formed, and we decided to go online and in-person to bring the messages of the Elders as far and wide as possible. We went on Social media, where our global community is constantly growing (see FB, Instagram, Twitter), and put up this website: https://wisdomweavers.world .
The gathering was filmed, and resulted (for now) in a 14 minutes film sharing the essence of the Elders' message. It was translated by volunteers into 15 languages, and was picked by Reuters for Earth-Day's 50th anniversary in 2020, where it was launched by them and us, reaching over 80K people in the first day of screening. 
It is now available on our website's home page: https://wisdomweavers.world , on Vimeo, Youtube and social media.

What the Elders said then, is becoming clearer and clearer as the days go by. "As the whirlwind intensifies - stay in your heart center, said the Elders, asking & guiding us to reconnect to our hearts. 

Thank you.
Aang waan, hello my other self, In 2017 on Kaua'i, Hawai'i 13 Elders from around the world gathered to answer two questions: What is the state of the world as they see it now? & What must we be doing now? The result was a co-created message from the Elders and a request from the Elders that I head the efforts to carry it to humanity. A support-team was formed, and we decided to go online and in-person to bring the messages of the Elders as far and wide as possible. We went on Social media, where our global community is constantly growing (see FB, Instagram, Twitter), and put up this website: https://wisdomweavers.world . The gathering was filmed, and resulted (for now) in a 14 minutes film sharing the essence of the Elders' message. It was translated by volunteers into 15 languages, and was picked by Reuters for Earth-Day's 50th anniversary in 2020, where it was launched by them and us, reaching over 80K people in the first day of screening. It is now available on our website's home page: https://wisdomweavers.world , on Vimeo, Youtube and social media. What the Elders said then, is becoming clearer and clearer as the days go by. "As the whirlwind intensifies - stay in your heart center, said the Elders, asking & guiding us to reconnect to our hearts. Thank you.

Anchorage, Alaska
Anchorage, Alaska
Recent clients include: Alaska Native Science Commission, Alaska Humanities Forum, Alaska Marine Conservation Council, University of Alaska Anchorage, Society for Advancement of Chicano and Native American Student, University of Alaska Fairbanks, University of Alaska Anchorage, Eyak Preservation Council, State of Alaska Department of Environmental Conservation, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Alaska Native Tribal Health Consortium, Aleut International Association. Co-author of two books: Aleut Wisdom: Stories From an Aleut Messenger (Second Story Press, in French), Stop Talking: Indigenous Ways of Teaching and Learning (University of Alaska Anchorage-Center for Faculty Excellence).

I received a grant from the Kalliopeia Foundation that allowed me to put up a website: www.gcill.org which stands for Global Center for Indigenous Leadership and Lifeways concentrating on wisdom of indigenous elders for modern times.. I also speak about individual and community wellness. I received a second grant from Kalliopeia that allowed me to write a third book which was published July 19, 2016 by North Atlantic Books called "Wisdomkeeper: One Mans Journey to Honor the Untold Story of the Unangan People". It is about the wisdom of Elders through the lens of my life.

Larry is a dear friend and one of the most brilliant people I have ever met. He uses humor, imagery, and laughter to tell his story and you get just a glimmer of the depth of his wisdom. I am blessed to have met him and to be able to call him a friend.
